item.title: Xbox May Be Dying, But Consoles Games Are Alive And Well, Says Analyst
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

There are a lot of questions about the future of Xbox as a brand, when games like The Outer Worlds 2 and even its signature shooter, Halo, is coming to PlayStation 5. Microsoft is reportedly working on the next generation of Xbox, but the outlook doesn't look promising. However, Xbox's perceived decline doesn't mean that consoles are dead, according a prominent video game analyst.

Rhys Elliott's Alinea Insight newsletter has shared the estimated sales for PlayStation 5 games in October 2025, and the two big winners were Battlefield 6, EA Sports FC 26, and Ghost of Yotei, with 3.2 million, 3 million, and 2.7 million in sales, respectively. The trio's nearly combined 9 million in sales led Elliott to remark, "AAA games, live services, and single-player alike, are still thriving on console. The 'CoNsOlE iS DeAd' narrative is getting annoying. Xbox as a console is dying, yes. But let's not extrapolate that too far, eh?"

Publishing Xbox games on PlayStation 5 has already paid dividends for Microsoft. Several of Microsoft's formerly exclusive titles dominated the PlayStation sales charts earlier this year.

Minecraft and Grand Theft Auto 5 both placed in the top 10, at fourth and seventh, respectively. That's thanks in part to a continuous flow of new content via Minecraft expansions and GTA Online. Additionally, EA Sports took three of the top 10 slots between FC 26, FC 25, and Madden NFL 26. Take-Two's NBA 2K26 took the fifth slot with 564,000 copies sold for the month.

Alinea Insight's top 10 best-selling PS5 games for October 2025 and their estimated sales are reproduced below.

  1. Battlefield 6 - 3.2 million
  2. EA Sports FC 26 - 3.0 million
  3. Ghost of Yotei - 2.7 million
  4. Minecraft - 635,000
  5. NBA 2K26 - 564,000
  6. EA FC 25 - 350,000
  7. Grand Theft Auto 5 - 338,000
  8. EA Madden NFL 26 - 261,000
  9. Little Nightmares 3 - 245,000
  10. Digimon Story: Time Stranger - 241,000

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Call Of Duty Black Ops 7 PC System Requirements: Here's What You'll Need For November 14
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

In just 10 days, the next installment of Call of Duty will arrive. Activision has already shared the details about when fans can preload Call of Duty: Black Ops 7. Now, the publisher has disclosed what your PC specs need to be in order to play Black Ops 7. That intel was released alongside a new trailer for Black Ops 7 on PC.

Activision notes that Black Ops 7 will only support Intel/AMD processors (with AVX instruction set), and that Intel ARC GPUs require Resizable Bar. The game also needs a broadband internet connection and DirectX12 compatibility. TPM 2.0 and Secure Boot are mandatory as well.

Minimum Specifications For Call of Duty: Black Ops 7

  • OS: Windows 10 64 Bit (latest update)
  • CPU: AMD Ryzen 5 1400 or Intel Core i5-6600
  • RAM: 8 GB
  • Video Card: AMD Radeon RX 470 or NVIDIA GeForce GTX 970 / 1060 or Intel Arc A580
  • Video Memory: 3 GB
  • Storage Space: SSD with 116 GB available space at launch

Recommended Specifications For Call of Duty: Black Ops 7

Recommended specs to run at 60FPS in most situations with all options set to high.

  • OS: Windows 11 64 Bit (latest update)
  • CPU: AMD Ryzen 5 1600X or Intel Core i7-6700K
  • RAM: 12 GB
  • Video Card: AMD Radeon RX 6600XT or NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3060 or Intel Arc B580
  • Video Memory: 8 GB
  • Storage Space: SSD with 116 GB available space at launch

Competitive / Ultra 4k Specifications For Call of Duty: Black Ops 7

Competitive specs to run at a high FPS for use with a high refresh monitor, and Ultra specs to run the game at a high FPS in 4K resolution.

  • OS: Windows 11 64 Bit (latest update)
  • CPU: AMD Ryzen 5 5600X or Intel Core i7-10700K
  • RAM: 16 GB
  • Video Card: AMD Radeon RX 9070XT or NVIDIA GeForce RTX 4080 / 5070
  • Video Memory: 16 GB
  • Storage Space: SSD with 116 GB available space at launch

Recommended Drivers

  • AMD: 25.9.2
  • NVIDIA: 581.42
  • INTEL: 32.0.101.8132

Black Ops 7 will officially launch at midnight local time on November 14 for PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox One, Xbox Series X|S, and Xbox on PC. However, players on Battle.net and Steam will be able to start the action on November 13 9 PM PT / November 14 12 AM ET.

Outside of the game, the Call of Duty movie is starting to take shape. Yellowstone creator Taylor Sheridan will co-write the script alongside the film's director, Peter Berg. No other specific details about the film are currently known.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com



https://www.gamespot.com/articles/call-of-duty-black-ops-7-pc-system-requirements-heres-what-youll-need-for-november-14/1100-6535929/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

item.title: Odds Chronicle Rolls Luck And Strategy Into A Tabletop-Inspired Roguelite
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Roguelite is one of the hottest subgenres in gaming right now. From Balatro to Drop Duchy, developers have integrated cyclical mechanics into all sorts of other genres. Independent studios eSolu and Team Mojo Games are adding another game to the subgenre with Odds Chronicles.

Odds Chronicles combines grid-based combat, a roguelite run structure, and dice mechanics to create its overall package. Each roll of the dice will give your team different resources, including attributes like strength and magic.

Dice-based roguelites and roguelikes, including standouts like Dicey Dungeons, have been around for some time, but new takes on rolling the dice are welcome. Bringing dice mechanics into a turn-based grid tactics game is a nice way to build off the SOCOM-like percentages that decide whether or not you'll land your attacks.

We don't have much to go on besides the reveal trailer, but the gameplay and visuals look polished enough to make Odds Chronicles stand out among a sea of other roguelites. The tactical roguelite will launch on Steam and Epic Games Store in 2026, with versions for PlayStation 5, Nintendo Switch, and Xbox Series X|S arriving later.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com



https://www.gamespot.com/articles/odds-chronicle-rolls-luck-and-strategy-into-a-tabletop-inspired-roguelite/1100-6535923/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

item.title: Arc Raiders Market Correction Quest Guide
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

As you work your way through Tian Wen's questline in Arc Raiders, you'll eventually begin a quest called Market Correction, which tasks you with finding and sabotaging a cache in the Buried City. This quest is relatively straightforward in execution, but finding the precise spot where the cache is located might prove a bit tricky--especially in the midst of chaotic battles with the ARC and other raiders who may be working on the same quest.

When you're ready to complete Market Correction, you can follow the steps below to round up the cache at Marano Station and be one step closer to finishing up Tian Wen's expectations for you.

Where to find the cache at Marano Station in Arc Raiders

Market Correction takes place in the Buried City map. You won't need to extract to complete the quest, so feel free to load in using a Free Loadout if you're worried you might not make it back alive.

Your destination is Marano Station, which is located on the northwestern side of the map in the Outskirts area. This whole side of the map is filled with debris and walls for cover, so you can sneak your way into Marano Station without too many worries.

When you arrive, you'll be looking for a set of canisters against a wall at the station. There are two different sets of these near each other, but you need to visit the ones in the north.

When you've discovered the correct canisters at Marano Station, interact with them once to identify the cache. Afterward, interact with them a second time to sabotage the cache. Doing so will complete the quest for Tian Wen.

You're now free to extract (or die trying). The Northern Station beside the nearby Library is likely to be your best bet. Passing through this point of interest will let you do some looting, too, which isn't a bad idea given that you may be using a Free Loadout and don't have much to lose by running into aggressive raiders.

If you're curious about what else is coming up, check out every quest in Arc Raiders.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com



https://www.gamespot.com/articles/arc-raiders-market-correction-quest-guide/1100-6535925/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

item.title: All Arc Raiders Quests - Full Mission List
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Arc Raiders is an extraction shooter that takes place in a punishing world featuring robotic enemies that can destroy you for making one wrong move. When you add in the threat of other players who might want to kill you and take your loot, too, you really need to make sure you're prepared to fight at all times. But there's a bit more to the game than just survival, as there are also a variety of quests to complete that can provide you with resources that will help you on your journey through Speranza. Below, we've listed out every quest you can undertake in Arc Raiders.

Arc Raiders missions list

There are currently 63 quests in Arc Raiders, though more will be added with future updates. As of right now, you can expect to spend dozens of hours completing these quests, which task you with finding spots on the map to interact with, looting unique resources to return safely to someone in Speranza, or defeating specific enemy types.

Want us to remember this setting for all your devices?

Sign up or Sign in now!

Please use a html5 video capable browser to watch videos.

This video has an invalid file format.

Sorry, but you can't access this content!

Now Playing: Arc Raiders Everything To Know

Every quest is accepted by speaking to Traders in Speranza, and they'll need to be turned in after completion to receive any rewards. Additionally, some quests will be locked behind progression, so you'll need to keep pushing through your currently accepted tasks to continue unlocking new quests to tackle. If you're struggling to complete any of them, you may want to recruit a pal (or stranger) to watch your back.

Here is every quest currently available in Arc Raiders roughly in the order you'll see them unlock, though the order can change a little bit based on which quests you're completing before or after others.

  1. Picking Up the Pieces
  2. Clearer Skies
  3. Trash Into Treasure
  4. Off the Radar
  5. A Bad Feeling
  6. The Right Tool
  7. Hatch Repairs
  8. Safe Passage
  9. Down to Earth
  10. The Trifecta
  11. A Better Use
  12. What Goes Around
  13. Sparks Fly
  14. Greasing Her Palms
  15. A First Foothold
  16. Dormant Barons
  17. Mixed Signals
  18. What We Left Behind
  19. Doctor's Orders
  20. Medical Merchandise
  21. A Reveal in Ruins
  22. Broken Monument
  23. Marked for Death
  24. Straight Record
  25. A Lay of the Land
  26. Market Correction
  27. Keeping the Memory
  28. Reduced to Rubble
  29. With a Trace
  30. Eyes on the Prize
  31. Echoes of Victory Ridge
  32. Industrial Espionage
  33. Unexpected Initiative
  34. A Symbol of Unification
  35. Celeste's Journals
  36. Back on Top
  37. The Major's Footlocker
  38. Out of the Shadows
  39. Eyes in the Sky
  40. Our Presence Up There
  41. Communication Hideout
  42. After Rain Comes
  43. A Balanced Harvest
  44. Untended Garden
  45. The Root of the Matter
  46. Water Troubles
  47. Into the Fray
  48. Source of the Contamination
  49. Switching the Supply
  50. A Warm Place to Rest
  51. Prescriptions of the Past
  52. Power Out
  53. Lost in Transmission
  54. Flickering Threat
  55. Bees!
  56. Espresso
  57. Life of a Pharmacist
  58. Tribute to Toledo
  59. Digging Up Dirt
  60. Turnabout
  61. Building a Library
  62. A New Type of Plant
  63. Armored Transports

For more on Arc Raiders, check out All Field Depot Locations and don't forget to use our Arc Raiders tips.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com
